    mclapply.hack: forking for Windows

    Source: R/utils.R
    mclapply.hack.Rd

    This function mimics forking (done with mclapply in Mac or Linux) for the Windows environment. Designed to be used just like mclapply. Credit goes to Nathan VanHoudnos. (Extremely) lightly adapted from: https://github.com/nathanvan/mcmc-in-irt/blob/master/post-10-mclapply-hack.R

    post-10-mclapply.hack.R

    Nathan VanHoudnos

    nathanvan AT northwestern FULL STOP edu

    July 14, 2014

    Last Edit: August 26, 2014

    A script to implement a hackish version of

    parallel:mclapply() on Windows machines.

    Usage

    mclapply.hack(..., verbose = FALSE, mc.cores = NULL)

    Arguments

    verbose

    Should users be warned this is hack-y? Defaults to FALSE.

    See also

    mclapply

    Examples

    mclapply.hack()
#> Error in if ((is.na(cores) || cores < 1L) && is.null(affinity.list)) stop("'mc.cores' must be >= 1"): missing value where TRUE/FALSE needed

    On this page

    Developed by David Van Dijcke, Florian Gunsilius, Siyun He.
